name: overcrowding
description: Overcrowding - too many workers reduce efficiency
story: Low extinguish efficiency (Îº=0.3) means diminishing returns from multiple workers at the same fire, while lower rewards (A=50) reduce the value of saving houses. Moderate work cost (c=0.6) punishes inefficient clustering. The challenge is coordinating to avoid overcrowding while still addressing fires.
research_questions: Can agents learn to avoid overcrowding fires?
What is the optimal team size per fire in this scenario?
Does signaling help prevent redundant effort?
How does lower reward affect cooperation incentives?
